Hi, I’m Dan.

An experienced designer who sincerely believes design can make a positive difference in people’s lives.
I am passionate about working with good people to find simple solutions to complex problems.

Most recently I was a Senior Designer at Modest, an early-stage mobile commerce startup in Chicago. I was responsible for the user experience of our native iOS and Android apps, new retailer on-boarding, and store management tools.

Mobile Commerce Apps
Modest
Control Panel
Modest

As one of the first employees, I helped take the product from conception to launch over the course of a year.

 
Decision Makers
Change.org
Product Design
Trunk Club

As a freelance designer I've worked with some great organizations like Change.org, Trunk Club, OpenGovFoundation, Precision Strategies, Northwestern University, Planned Parenthood, and many more. I'm currently accepting new work, and would love to hear from you.

Prior to that I was fortunate enough to have the experience of a lifetime, as Lead Interactive Designer for Barack Obama’s 2012 re-election campaign. I designed social organizing platforms, fundraising tools, and data visualizations that were used by millions of people and raised millions of dollars. I was then named Design Director while the organization transitioned from a campaign into Organizing for Action.

Ohio Recovery Map
Obama for America

I had countless unforgettable experiences, and got the chance to work alongside some of the most talented people I’ve ever met.

Before moving to Chicago for the campaign, I lived in Seattle where I cut my teeth at different agencies working for clients like Nintendo, Target, Microsoft, HTC, and Madison Square Garden.

Reader Prototypes
A large online retailer
Mario Super Sluggers
Nintendo
Transformation Site
Madison Square Garden

Throughout my career I’ve had the pleasure of working alongside talented, generous people who are passionate about their work. I’ve seen the positive impact design can have under those circumstances.

I’m not quite sure what’s next. But I hope to work with mission-driven organizations that value design, and offer the chance for continued personal growth. If that sounds like you, please do get in touch.
